snippet: People at the scene of an attack are more likely to survive if they take an active stance, studies and police departments say, a shift from previous guidelines that advocated waiting for help.
abstract: Police departments across the nation now recommend that people flee, hide or fight back in event of a mass attack, instead of remaining passive and waiting for help; speed and deadliness of recent high-profile shootings has prompted shift from previous guidelines.
lead_paragraph: People at the scene of an attack are more likely to survive if they take an active stance, studies and police departments say, a shift from previous guidelines that advocated waiting for help.

headline.seo: In Mass Attacks, Public Now Advised to Take Action
headline.main: In Shift, Police Advise Taking an Active Role to Counter Mass Attacks
headline.print_headline: In Shift, Police Advise Taking an Active Role to Counter Mass Attacks
